title: Wildlife Disease Data Standard
description: Flexible data standard for wildlife disease data

sampleID.description: A researcher-generated unique ID for the sample: usually a unique string of both characters and integers (e.g., “OS BZ19-114” to indicate an oral swab taken from animal BZ19-114; see worked example below), to avoid conflicts that can arise when datasets are merged with number-only notation for samples. Ideally, sample names should be kept consistent across all online databases and physical resources (e.g., museum collections or project-specific sample archives).

animalID.description: A researcher-generated unique ID for the individual animal from which the sample was collected: usually a unique string of both characters and integers (e.g., “BZ19-114” to indicate animal 114 sampled in 2019 in Belize). Ideally, animal names should again be kept consistent across online databases and physical resources.

latitute.description: Latitude of the collection site in decimal format.

longitude.description: Longitude of the collection site  in decimal format.

spatialUncertaintiy.description: Coordinate uncertainty from GPS recordings, post-hoc digitization, or systematic alterations (e.g., jittering or rounding) expressed in meters.

eventBased.description: Whether or not research was conducted in response to a known or suspected infectious disease outbreak, observed animal morbidity or mortality, etc.

archival.description: Whether samples were from an archival source (e.g., museum collections, biobanks).

creators.description: The full names of the creators. Should be in the format familyName, givenName.

titles.description: A name or title by which a resource is known.

publicationYear.description: The year when the data was or will be made publicly available.

rights.description: Any rights information for this resource.

description.description: All additional information that does not fit in any of the other categories. May be used for technical information or detailed information associated with a scientific instrument.

language.description: The primary language of the resource.

fundingReferences.description: Name and other identifying information of a funding provider.
